adjective.description: (of a person, manner, or gesture) displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort; slow and relaxed.
examples: they turned with languid movements from back to front so as to tan evenly

adjective.description: Weak or faint from illness or fatigue.
examples: she was pale, languid, and weak, as if she had delivered a child

origin: Late 16th century (in languid (sense 2)): from French languide or Latin languidus, from languere (see languish).
